W-Am: Hello, Mr. Tan. Q1 Didn’t your company use Zane Staffing Company to find a lot of your employees? Are you happy with the service they provide?
M-Au: Yes, we’ve used Zane several times to find qualified temporary help.
W-Am: Now that it's summer, Q2 my landscaping business is getting pretty busy. I'd like to hire a few part-time employees to help with some of our larger outdoor jobs.
M-Au: Q3 Oh, actually Zane focuses on filling office jobs, so I don’t think that their company would be the right one for you. I’m sure if you look on the Internet, you'll find a company that specializes in staffing for landscaping work, though.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
What type of business does the woman own?
What does the man suggest?

answer.explanation:
W: Nice to meet you, Mr. Gomez. I’m sure after you hear about our business, you will want us to provide food and beverages for your company’s various events.
M: Nice to meet you, Ms. Gates. Thank you for coming today. I haven’t inquired about your services because your company is located out of town. I didn’t think you could provide services to US.
W: Rose and Lily Co. is willing to travel anywhere within the state in order to meet our clients’ needs. Our prices don’t change depending on distance, so you don’t need to worry about that.
M: Oh, I’m glad to hear that. In that case, we will consider your services. What are your specialties? Do you think I could sample some of the food and beverages you provide?

question.text: What kind of services are the speakers discussing?
Why has the man not used Rose and Lily Co.’s services before?
choices: (B) He was reluctant to pay a membership fee.
(C) He was on bad terms with the owner.
(D) He did not realize their availability.

answer.text: (D) He did not realize their availability.

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M: I’m concerned about the output of some of our machinery. Q1 Production has slowed by 8% since June. I think there must be a problem with the software. We are losing money over this, and I’m not sure who to ask about it.
W: We had it repaired once in the past but it was so expensive we ended up just buying a new one. Now it Is slowing down as well. Do you think we should just replace the machine again?
M: Q2 Yeah, it doesn’t make sense to keep going like this.
W: Q3 I’ll call the machine repair shop and get a quote on the repairs and we can decide what to do.
M: OK, but let’s get it done as quickly as possible please.

question.text: What is the man worried about?
choices: (B) The production rate of the machine

answer.text: (B) The production rate of the machine

question.text: What does the man imply when he says “It doesn’t make sense to keep going like this”?
choices: (A) He wants to take action immediately.
(B) He wants to continue business as usual,
(C) He wants to repair the software.
(D) He doesn’t agree with the woman.

answer.text: (A) He wants to take action immediately.

W: No problem. If you prefer, we can leave it with someone at your office?
M: Q2 That won’t work for me. The delivery contains some expensive pieces of art so I want to personally receive it.
W: That’s fine. When would you like it delivered?

Transcript:
W1: Hi, can I please talk to Robert Porter? It’s regarding the repairs to the office equipment at Baker & McKenzie. He is the Head Engineer, right?
W2: Yes. May I ask who is calling?
W1: This is Susan Sherman. I’m the maintenance manager at Baker & McKenzie. Some of our equipment is missing and I’d like to know where it is, and when we will get it back.
W2: OK, wait a moment. I will try to put you through to Robert. Please hold the line.
W1: Thank you.
M: Hello? Susan?
W1: Hi Robert, I’m calling in regards to the missing office equipment you repaired at Baker & McKenzie yesterday. Where is it and when will we get it back?
M: Oh, I left a note with your receptionist. I told her we needed to take it away to our workshop for special repairs. We should have it ready by the end of the week.

answer.text: (C) Some of their equipment is missing.

Script
W-Br: Let’s talk about November’s cover. This month’s issue is about trends in smartphone technology, and we’re selected our cover photo for that. Now, which stories should be mentioned on the cover?
M-Au: Reiko is working on a story about teaching people how to develop their own applications for smartphones.
W-Br: Oh, that’s a good angle. But do you think that’s cover-page material?
M-Au: It’s got an educational theme, and she’s interviewed people from many age groups for the story. I think it’ll be attract a lot of readers who don’t normally buy our magazine.
W-Br: Good point. Let’s put Reiko’s headline just below the cover photo. Any ideas for which stories to put on the sides of the center photo?

SPRINGFIELD DANCE TROUPE CLASS SCHEDULE

Class Mon Tue Web Thu Fri Sat Sun
Hiphop X X X Tiffany 11-2 Tiffany 11-2 Owen 11-2 Owen 11-2
Swing Beth 11-2 Beth 11-2 Beth 11-2 Beth 11-2 Beth 11-2 X X
Jazz Gwen 5-8 X Gwen 5-8 X X Gwen 5-8 X
Ballet Sally 1-4 Sally 1-4 X X X X X

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
Q1 Springfield Dance Troupe has just added a new hip-hop workshop to our winter schedule. We are extremely excited to be able to offer more temporary dance routines to the members of our community! Q3 We'll be having a live performance of some of the moves that we will be teaching people to master this Saturday at 12:00 P.M. We would like to invite all members of the community, young and old, boys and girls, to come down to the Recreational Center and enjoy the performance. Springfield Dance Troupe will of course be continuing to teach the courses that we have always offered, with one exception. Sally Jones, who many of you know from her fantastic Nutcracker performances, will be moving back to Westport. As a result, after this week we will not be offering ballet classes until we can find a teacher to replace her. I hope to see you all at the Recreation Center this Saturday at noon!

question.text: What is indicated about Springfield Dance Troupe?
choices: (A) They are changing the music they like.
(B) They are moving to a new location.
(C) They want to find a new swing class instructor.
(D) They are adding a new course.

answer.text: (D) They are adding a new course.

question.text: Look at the graphic. What can you infer about the dance classes?
choices: (C) Dance classes last for three hours.

answer.text: (C) Dance classes last for three hours.

question.text: What does Springfield Dance Troupe invite the public to do?
choices: (B) See them in the concert hall downtown
(C) Watch them perform a hip hop dance routine

answer.text: (C) Watch them perform a hip hop dance routine

answer.explanation: W-Am: Welcome everyone. Q1 I'll be taking you on a guided tour of the Lakeside Art Museum today. In the nineteenth century, the breathtaking scenery and mild climate attracted many artists to this area. That's why you'll find such an extensive collection of oil paintings from that era. Before we start, Q2 I see many of you have cameras out. Please note that this is a private collection. Don't worry, though, you can buy postcards with images of the paintings. So thanks in advance for your cooperation. Q3 Later this afternoon, make sure to visit our cafe located on the outdoor terrace, where you can enjoy a delicious lunch. So let's begin.

MIDNIGHT CRUISE ITINERARY
5:00 P.M Captain's address
6:00 P.M Cocktails and dinner
7:00 P.M Constellation orientation
8:00 P.M- 10:00 P.M Social Mixer
10:00 P.M Port Lewis for champagne toast
11:00 P.M Cast off and back to Billing's Bay
12:00 P.M Midnight constellation lesson and meteor shower on Top Deck

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
Welcome aboard the Midnight Cruise, Loveport’s most romantic evening! We will be spending the majority of our cruise in Billing’s Bay, but we will also be following the coastline of Eagle Island to Port Lewis for a champagne toast. During our cruise, our host, Star master Jenkins, will be directing you through the constellations that are in view, and with any luck we will be able to witness tonight’s meteor shower! While we are cruising, we ask that you wear your life jackets at all times when on deck for your safety. If you begin to feel sea sick at any time, I encourage you to visit our on-board clinic for some medication. Now I would like to ask everybody to join the captain in the stateroom for a rundown of this evening’s services!

question.text: Where will the cruise spend most of its time?
Who is Star master Jenkins?
Look at the graphic. How long will the cruise be stopped at Port Lewis?

answer.explanation: Q1 Is your construction company trying to expand? Do you find it hard to compete with other businesses because your equipment is old and inefficient? Then Millenium Tools has the products you’ve been looking for. We’ve designed a sleek, completely modern line of construction tools that will cut down the time of your project. Whether you specialize in residential or commercial buildings, Q2 our tools are designed to help you maximize your team’s efficiency. Q3 Don’t waste time with outdated equipment! Visit one of our retail outlets for a demonstration of the newest models available. Call 567-2424 for a list of locations and opening times. You’ll be glad you did

question.text: Who is the advertisement most likely for?
What does the speaker say about his company products?
choices: (A) They are more efficient than older models.
(B) They are less expensive than a competitor's.
(D) They are available only for a short time.

answer.text: (A) They are more efficient than older models.

question.text: How are listeners invited to respond to the advertisement?
A reception will be held to introduce the newly _______ director of marketing to the employees of Kaulana Industries.
In a strong display of confidence, the firm’s board of directors____approved the merger.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer.

question.text: Orvale School s business mentors are retired executives with a ______ of expertise across a wide range of industries.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: The course taught by Prof. Brennink is intended for  _____ interested in medical or health-related careers.

answer.explanation: Use a pronoun after the preposition “for” and followed by a reduced relative clause (interested in)

question.text: During the hotel renovation, special ___ was given to the lighting fixtures and decorations.

answer.explanation: Attention = Focus

question.text: The advertising budget is divided ___ among the three divisions in the marketing department.

answer.explanation: We are giving more information on the verb "is divided" so we use an adverb.

question.text: The first prize presented was the Kozar Award for  ______ in educational toy design.

answer.explanation: Need a noun after the preposition "for".

question.text: We will review all four custodial-service bids and choose____that suits our needs.

answer.explanation:
One word needs to be the singular subject to singular to match the verb "suits" to divide the singular 'number.

Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer.

question.text: The seafood sold by Pacific Plus is ______  and therefore must be transported in a temperature-controlled vehicle.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
=> D

question.text: We will make a final decision about changing the landscaping of the property after reviewing the _____ costs.

answer.explanation:
Need an Adj before Noun (costs) to add Noun => A, B- not correct.
- We have the phrase: Estimated cost
=> Choose C

question.text: Once invoices arrive in the office, they should be processed ___ in order to maintain accurate records.

answer.explanation:
We are giving more information on the verb "be processed" so we use an adverb.
Promptly = Immediately = Quickly

question.text: The maintenance team’s repair requests should be _____ in groups according to the urgency.

answer.explanation:
Passive form of should
=> Choose C

question.text: No firm can ___ to rely forever only on the strength of Its name to sell products.

answer.explanation: Afford to do st = Be able to do st

question.text: Ms. Watson looks forward to ___ possible investment options at the November meeting.

answer.explanation: Look foward to doing st = Hope to do st

question.text: Larper Painting ___ a special sale next month to celebrate its new store on Abagael Avenue.

answer.explanation:
Run st = Manage st
"Next month" means that the action will be in the future so we choose "will be running" as there is no "by" for the answer to be passive voice.

question.text: ___we paid the painters a lot of money, they did a terrible job.

answer.explanation: (C) “Although” shows a contrast between the two clauses. Choices (A) and (B) are used to show a cause-and-effect relationship. Choice (D) is normally followed by a noun, not by a clause.

question.text: Great ___ in tourism levels have had a significant impact on the success of Darling Beach’s small businesses.

answer.explanation: Fluctuation = Frequent change

question.text: Denton's city planning committee will ___ place recycling receptacles at the entrances of Fairview Park.

answer.explanation: We are giving more information on the verb "will place" so we use an adverb.

question.text: You can sign the document now,___you can speak to an attorney first if you prefer.

answer.explanation: (C) In this sentence, “or” indicates a choice between two actions. Choice (A) would be used to add a clause with similar information. Choice (B) indicates a contradiction between the two clauses. Choice (D) is used in negative sentences.

question.text: Landlords are required to   _____  with the regulations set by the Regional Department of Safe Housing.

answer.explanation:
comply with orders, rules, or requests
=> Choose B

question.text: _____, the cabin will be rented out for the entire month, but the owner would agree to four weekly rentals instead.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose C

question.text: The last train to Hamburg ___ at 10:30.

answer.explanation: (B) The sentence requires a present third person singular or past tense verb; only “departs” is given. Choice (A) is present tense, but not third person singular. Choice (C) is the infinitive. Choice (D) is an -ing form.

question.text: ………………………reducing staff, management made the decision to decrease administrative bonuses.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
=> A

question.text: The new building will be dedicated___June 30.

answer.explanation: (A) The preposition “on” is used to indicate the exact date when something will occur. Choices (B), (C), and (D) are not used in this context.

question.text: Despite heavy competition from established carriers, Sopot Airlines has managed to do more than just ___ in the narrow luxury niche.

answer.explanation: Do more than just + V = Not just do st

question.text: At Razani Marketing, there are ______ opportunities for professional advancement.

answer.explanation: Use a modifier for the plural noun “opportunities”

question.text: The participants will be judged on _____  performance, and the winners will be announced later in the awards ceremony.

answer.explanation:
The blank precedes a noun => need an adjective to modify it
=> Choose B

question.text: The product development team for Herbeve Cosmetics is  _____ a package redesign to try to increase sales.

answer.explanation: Choose a main verb: auxiliary verb "is" and has an active meaning

question.text: The main ___ of the new electronic notepad is Internet use.

answer.explanation:
The answer comes after an adjective so we use a noun. There is "is" so we use the noun in its singular form.
Fuction = Purpose

question.text: _____Mr. Williams addressed the audience, he showed a brief video about the engine he had designed.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose C

question.text:
Employee Message Board
Request for Feedback
Posted by James Frohm, Human Resources Director

Hello colleagues,
The holiday season is fast approaching and we need to (1) ______ our office party! There have been several (2) ______ for locations and themes made to me directly, but I wanted to invite everyone in the office to give me their feedback. All ideas are welcome, but I must remind everyone that our office (3) ______ . Our party can include all forms of secular celebration, but out of respect for everyone, there may be no religious themes. Please respond to me directly by e-mail at jamesfrohm@ccn.net, so I can get started making plans. (4) ______.
Sincerely,
James
The holiday season is fast approaching and we need to (1) ______ our office party!
There have been several (2) ______ for locations and themes made to me directly, but I wanted to invite everyone in the office to give me their feedback
All ideas are welcome, but I must remind everyone that our office (3) ______ .
choices: (A) is a safe space for all customs and cultures

answer.text: (A) is a safe space for all customs and cultures

question.text: Please respond to me directly by e-mail at jamesfrohm@ccn.net, so I can get started making plans. (4) ______.
choices: (A) I look forward to your ideas and enthusiasm.
(B) I’m look forward to your ideas and enthusiasm.
(C) I look forward to your undivided attention.
(D) I hope you reply before its too late.

answer.text: (A) I look forward to your ideas and enthusiasm.

question.text: Come visit Wild Water Parks, your summer destination for family and friends of all ages. We have kiddie pools, we have outdoor pools, we have indoor pools, we have waves, and we have (1) _____ water slides, including our Death Fall, the largest slide in the state. We have everything for everyone in (2) _____group. Don't forget our delicious snack stands and restaurants. We also have gift shops and playgrounds. (3)_____ You can get tickets by calling 123-5555 or a season's pass for a (4) ______  of the price. Call now and experience the fun!
we have (1) _____ water slides, including our Death Fall, the largest slide in the state.

answer.explanation: Use an adjective in form of present participle to modify the noun "water slides"

question.text: We have everything for everyone in (2) _____group.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words

question.text: (3)_____ You can get tickets by calling 123-5555
choices: (A) The pools are the best place to stay.
(B) We even have a dog park for that furry companion of yours
(C) The chefs are top notch and the food is second to none.
(D) Hurry before the season is over and the promotion is finishes.

answer.text: (B) We even have a dog park for that furry companion of yours
answer.explanation: The entire passage is about "park" so B is the right answer.

question.text: You can get tickets by calling 123-5555 or a season’s pass for a (4)____ of the price.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words

question.text:
http://www.midwestartisanalcheeseguild.org
The Midwest Artisanal Cheese Guild
(MAGG) organizes trade shows and conducts educational seminars -135.-— the cheese- crafting trade within the midwestern United States. Cheeses from this region are recognized internationally. Many of -136.-— cheeses are used by chefs at restaurants around the world.
The MAGG puts on the region's largest cheese- maker exposition, held each year in April. The prestigious Wizard of Cheese contest is held at this event. -—137.—. Dan Travella was last year's —138—-. His aged Cheddar cheese received a winning score of 98.7 out of 100.

answer.explanation: The previous clauses are already a complete proposition, so it is impossible to choose answers A, C, D
The plural -> "these" is the best answer

choices: (A)Local firm Bromatel demonstrates the latest in cheese- making technology.
(B)Next year some new conference activities are planned.
(D)Hotel reservations can be made on our Web site.

answer.explanation: Choose related sentences based on the previous sentence “The Wizard of Cheese contest is held at this event ”
Choose the correct answer based on the following: “His aged cheddar cheese received a winning score of 98.7 out of 100”

question.text:
refer to the following letter.

October 2

Vincent Hubbard
406 Paige Drive
Rulston, FL 32029

Dear Mr. Hubbard,

Last Thursday evening, two Water Department employees dismantled part of the sidewalk in your neighborhood, near the intersection of Jerden Road and Paige Drive. (1). Unfortunately, the time and way in which the work was performed alarmed area residents, who believed that the technicians were (2) an illegal act.
This incident reflects a (3) oversight on our part, and we are taking steps to prevent its recurrence. Specifically, we have instituted new regulations that call for work crews to wear high-visibility uniforms at all times. Again, we are sorry for the (4).

Thank you for your understanding in this matter.

Sincerely,

Aimee Ross
Director, Rulston Water Department

choices: (A) Residents may be asked to move vehicles away from the curb.
(B) A new treatment plant was expected to improve the situation.
(C) They were attempting to find the source of a nearby leak.
(D) Restructuring efforts are leading to larger work crew sizes.

answer.text: (C) They were attempting to find the source of a nearby leak.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence " Last Thursday evening, two Water Department employees dismantled part of the sidewalk in your neighborhood, near the intersection of Jerden Road and Paige Drive."
Based on the meaning of words.
Based on structure " a/ an + adj + noun (oversight)"
Based on the meaning of words.

question.text:
Questions 147-148 refer to the following advertisement.

Immediate Opening
Shagani Construction needs two general construction workers for carpentry and other work. Must have own tools. Two years plumbing experience preferred. Work guaranteed July through September. Must have valid driver’s license. Send resume to lblock@saganaw.com by June. No phone calls please. Qualified candidates will be contacted.
What is NOT a requirement for the job?

answer.explanation: By the exclusion method, it can be seen that information in option (D) that is not mentioned is a requirement of the job. "Plumbing experience" is only "preferred", not a mandatory requirement.

question.text: What is suggested about the job?

answer.explanation: It is mentioned in a post that "Work guaranteed July through September." (Guaranteed work from April to September). This means that this job is only temporary, lasting for 3 months.

question.text:
To: Aaron Sandler - asandler@milleradvertising.com
From: Sam Miller - smiller@milleradvertising.com
Subject: Tuesday’s Meeting
Date: November 12

Dear Mr. Sandler,

This month’s business review meeting is scheduled for Thursday, November 15. As you know, this meeting is a great opportunity for US to assess our operating plan and to make any adjustments that might help US keep up with constant changes in the marketplace. As an advertising agency, it’s crucial we stay informed about the newest market trends. Therefore, I was excited when I heard that Tsuyoshi Ito, manager of our Japanese branch, would be visiting this Friday. In order to take advantage of his expertise and knowledge, I would like to change the meeting date so that Mr. Ito can attend.

This will be Mr. Ito’s first time in the country, so I would like you to pick him up from the airport. A company car will be provided to you for this purpose. I will e-mail again once I have more details concerning Mr. Ito’s arrival time.

Sincerely,

Sam Miller
President
Miller Advertising
What is the purpose of the e-mail?
choices: (B) To request a monthly operating report
(D) To propose a new marketing strategy

answer.explanation: The purpose of email is in the last sentence of paragraph 2 “In order to take advantage of his expertise and knowledge, I would like to change the meeting date so that Mr. Ito can attend. ”

question.text: What does the e-mail indicate about Mr. Ito?
choices: (D) He is a client of Mr. Miller’s.

answer.explanation: From the following information, “As an advertising agency”, “Tsuyoshi Ito, manager of our Japanese branch”, it can be inferred that Mr. Miller works at an advertising agency and Mr. Ito is the manager at the Japanese branch of that firm. So Mr. Ito works in the advertising industry.

question.text:
Arthur Chen 5:49 P.M. Eleanor sent you an e-mail with the sales figures a little while ago. She’s been wondering when she'll hear back from you.
Diego Montes 5:50 P.M. I'm not at my desk. Do you think she's concerned because the numbers are lower than expected?
Arthur Chen 5:50 P.M. Possibly.
Diego Montes 5:51 P.M. I got called away to check the bottling machine. It’s acting up.
Arthur Chen 5:52 P.M. Should I call a technician?
Diego Montes 5:54 P.M. I'm hoping to handle it myself. Why don't you arrange a conference call for Thursday afternoon? The team will need to discuss the report.
Arthur Chen 5:54 P.M. Will do.
At 5:50 P.M, what does Mr. Montes most likely mean when he writes, “I’m not at my desk”?
choices: (A) He has left for the day.
(C) He is visiting Mr. Chen's office.

answer.explanation: “Eleanor sent you an e-mail with the sales figures a little while ago. She’s been wondering when she’ll hear back from you”.

question.text: What task is Mr. Chen asked to do?

answer.explanation: Diego Montes 5:54 PM “Why don’t you arrange a conference call for Thursday afternoon?”

question.text: @PS@kstoeic/images/7297853_1484793085762.png@PE@
What information must the subscriber provide to receive promotional offers?

answer.explanation:
Information can be inferred from "Would you like to receive FREE offers and promotions from our partner companies via e-mail?"
The subscriber is required to tick on "Yes, my email address is______" to receive promotional offers.

choices: (B) The amount of time before delivery begins
(D) The cost of a multiple-year subscription

answer.text: (B) The amount of time before delivery begins
answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "Please allow 4-6 weeks for delivery of first issue"

question.text:
April 2 — Repairs will begin next Friday on the historic Marion Hall in downtown Marion. In its heyday, Marion Hall was a popular downtown destination for residents to dance, enjoy live music, and watch movies. However, it has lost its popularity gradually since the multiplex building was completed on Henson Street 4 years ago.
After all of the necessary repairs are made on Marion Hall, city officials will strive to invite various performers including famous theater companies, musicians, comedians, and speakers to the newly renovated theater. “We hope Marion Hall can serve as a new center for culture here in Marion,” said Marion City Mayor Greg Fields.
The revitalization of Marion Hall is part of a larger project to enhance the public facilities in Marion. On April 29, the Marion Children’s Park, which features a baseball field as well as several playgrounds, is scheduled to have its grand reopening.
What is suggested about Marion?
choices: (A) It will restore an old building soon.
(B) It has closed a park for repairs.
(C) It is planning a music festival.

answer.text: (A) It will restore an old building soon.
answer.explanation: The information is in: "Repairs will begin next Friday on the historic Marion Hall in downtown Marion."

question.text: What is the purpose of Marion Hall?
choices: (A) To serve as a play center for children

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: " In its heyday, Marion Hall was a popular downtown destination for residents to dance, enjoy live music, and watch movies."

question.text: What will happen in April?
choices: (A) A famous speaker will give a presentation.
(B) A new major will be elected
(C) Some public facilities will be improved
(D) A new play will be performed

answer.text: (C) Some public facilities will be improved
answer.explanation: Based on the information in: "After all of the necessary repairs are made on Marion Hall, city officials will strive to invite various performers including famous theater companies, musicians, comedians, and speakers to the newly renovated theater. “We hope Marion Hall can serve as a new center for culture here in Marion,” said Marion City Mayor Greg Fields."

question.text:
To: carlhurst@nicknet.com
From: m_winters@tatecc.com
Date: June 1, 1:34 P.M.
Subject: Community Events

Dear Mr. Hurst,
As a loyal customer with a family membership at the Tate Community Center, you have sponsored US with your continued donations. We really appreciate your support.
The following table provides information on upcoming family events this month. We welcome your participation.
Craft Day, June 7 Paul Simpson, June 15 Summer Picnic, June 22
A variety of craft supplies will be available for kids to make their own unique creations. Come and listen to the beautiful music of local singer and songwriter Paul Simpson. Everyone needs to bring a tasty dish to share with others. Free beverages will be provided.

For members, no purchase of tickets is necessary for participation in these events. We encourage you to attend these events and spend quality time with your family.
We look forward to seeing you.

Minnie Winters
Program Coordinator
Tate Community Center
What is suggested about Mr. Hurst?
choices: (D) He works at a community center.

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "As a loyal customer with a family membership at the Tate Community Center, you have sponsored US with your continued donations. "

question.text: Why was the e-mail sent?
choices: (A) To announce a community board meeting
(B) To apply for a family membership
(D) To give information about a local

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred form: "The following table provides information on upcoming family events this month. We welcome your participation."

question.text: What is indicated about Tate Community Center?
choices: (A) Its members gain free admission to the events.
(D) It will serve beverages at all events.

answer.text: (A) Its members gain free admission to the events.
answer.explanation: The information is in: "For members, no purchase of tickets is necessary for participation in these events. "

question.text:
Hochstein to Be Headed by Barrault Bondy Executive


February 10 — Recent movement of executives among the fashion industry's leading companies appears not to be ending anytime soon, Hochstein Shoes, Inc., Swiss-based retailer and manufacturer of men's shoes, announced today that its chief executive officer, Gerard Hullot, will retire, and that Angelica Ferrara, current executive vice-president of Barrault Bondy, will take his place.

Experts say the succession represents a major upset within the industry, since Barrault Bondy, the Paris-based manufacturer, is one of Hochstein's leading competitors in the high-end shoe market.

Hullot's departure comes as little surprise, however. He had publicly indicated his desire to retire in order to write a memoir of his long career in fashion, over thirty years of which were spent at Hochstein. Nevertheless, most experts had expected him to stay on until after November, when the company's winter collection is released.

Ferrara's move has generated much speculation about who will take her place at Barrault Bondy. Sources there indicate that current design director Marcel Hugo will be named the new executive vice president in a press release later this week.
What is the main topic of the article?
choices: (A)The retirement of a once successful product line
(B)A change within the leadership of two companies

answer.text: (B)A change within the leadership of two companies
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Hochstein Shoes, Inc., Swiss-based retailer and manufacturer of men's shoes, announced today that its chief executive officer, Gerard Hullot, will retire, and that Angelica Ferrara, current executive vice-president of Barrault Bondy, will take his place."

question.text: How does the article describe Mr. Hullot?
choices: (A)He has written several books on fashion.
(C)He is upset about competition from Barrault Bondy.
(D)He has spent much of his career at Hochstein.

answer.text: (D)He has spent much of his career at Hochstein.
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "He had publicly indicated his desire to retire in order to write a memoir of his long career in fashion, over thirty years of which were spent at Hochstein."

question.text: According to the article, what will probably happen later this week?
choices: (A)Barrault Bondy will make an official announcement.
(C)Mr. Hugo will replace Ms. Ferrara's designs with his own.
(D)Ms. Ferrara will announce new sources for shoe materials.

answer.text: (A)Barrault Bondy will make an official announcement.
answer.explanation: Information can be inferred from: "Sources there indicate that current design director Marcel Hugo will be named the new executive vice president in a press release later this week."

question.text:
Penny Jones 3:27
I just got a call from Martin that his client Mr. Patrick would like to have his order two weeks earlier than originally planned. So, by next week Monday essentially. Do you think this is possible? I'd like your input.
Karen Norman 3:28
There's no problem on our end. Most of the leather has already been cut. We've already sent many of the pieces to be sewn. The rest of the work should take a couple of hours.
Neil Park 3:29
The handles are complete and about half the bags are near completion. I'll get them to Lauren soon. I think we should be able to finish sewing the bags by tomorrow evening.
Penny Jones 3:30
I'm glad to hear that most of the handbags are almost finished. Lauren, how long will it take to get the hardware attached or sewn in?
Lauren Nichols 3:31
We're currently working on the Jenk and Cenk twin's orders...
Penny Jones 3:32
We have more than enough time to complete the twin's orders so I can authorize your workers to put aside that project for now. How long will Mr. Patrick's order take?
Lauren Nichols 3:33
The zippers need to be sewn in but the studs will be glued, which makes the work easier. I think we need about a day.
Kevin Harding 3:34
It'll take us only a couple of hours to have the order packaged safely to be shipped.
Penny Jones 3:35
Thank you so much. I'll let our client know.
What kind of business does the client most likely own?

answer.explanation:
In paragraph message chain refers to goods as handbags -> handbag business customers.
“The handles are complete and about half of the bags are near completion. I'll get them to Lauren soon. ”

question.text: According to the conversation, whose department must complete the work first?

answer.explanation: “There is no problem on our end. Most of the leather has already been cut. We've already sent many of the pieces to be sewn ”.

question.text: At 3:31, why does Lauren Nichols say “We’re currently working on the Jenk and Cenk twin’s orders”?
choices: (A) To inform everyone that they have their own clients
(B) To explain why they refuse to help
(C) To imply that they are busy with another project
(D) To make everyone speed up their work

answer.text: (C) To imply that they are busy with another project
answer.explanation:
Keyword:

“3:31” -> look for the passage with this time slot and read the surrounding information.

Lauren is talking about on other orders -> implying they're busy.

“We're currently working on the Jenk and Cenk twin's orders.

- We have more than enough time to complete the twin's orders so I can authorize your workers to put aside that project for now. ”

question.text: What will Penny Jones most likely tell Mr. Patrick?
choices: (A) That his order will be finished two weeks later
(B) That his request can be fulfilled
(C) That his order will cost him extra money
(D) That there may be a delay to his order

answer.text: (B) That his request can be fulfilled
answer.explanation: “Thank you so much. I'll let our client know ”.

question.text:
Wrightman Towers

1234 Broadway Street

New York, NY 49858

- [1] - Located in the financial district of the city, Wrightman Towers offers spectacular views of the city landscape and offers office spaces that are ideal for any company that wishes to operate within the heart of New York. Just one block from the subway station and located within walking distance of public buses and taxis, Wrightman Towers is conveniently located. - [2] - The first-floor lobby offers security as employees and residents must scan their way through the security gates to the elevators behind. At the same time the spacious lobby is welcoming with its luxurious interior designs and friendly staff of attendants. - [3] -
The third and fourth floors are available for rent to businesses and corporations. High ceilings and tall glass windows offer open space and beautiful natural lighting. Hurry and send in your requests today. - [4] - Only serious inquiries will be taken and interviews must be conducted in person. Please visit our website at www.wrightmantowers.com/rent for more information. You can take a virtual tour of the premises
What is indicated about the rental space?
choices: (A) It is only for private residents.
(C) It is available to the public.

answer.explanation: “Located in the financial district of the city, Wrightman Towers offers spectacular views of the city landscape and offers office spaces that are ideal for any company that wishes to operate within the heart of New York. ”

question.text: What is indicated about the location of Wrightman Towers?
choices: (B) It has heavy traffic around the building.
(D) It is just outside the city.

answer.explanation: “Just one block from the subway station and located within walking distance of public buses and taxis, Wrightman Towers is conveniently located.”

question.text: What is featured on the website?
choices: (A) A listing of all occupied spaces
(C) A virtual tour of the rental space

answer.text: (C) A virtual tour of the rental space
answer.explanation: “Please visit our website at www. wrightmantowers.com/rent for more information. You can take a virtual tour of the premises ”.

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence belong?
“These spaces are in high demand.”

answer.explanation: “Hurry and send in your requests today ...Only serious inquiries will be taken and interviews must be conducted in person”.

question.text:
Tamara Elkind / 3:32 P.M.
Thanks for attending the virtual sales meeting earlier this afternoon. Are there any further questions?

Judith Messer / 3:35 P.M.
Georg and I are unclear about how the new sales territory maps affect existing customers. Do the new territories apply only to new customers?

Tamara Elkind / 3:37 P.M.
No, the new territories apply to both new and existing customers.

Judith Messer / 3:38 P.M.
So, does that mean I will no longer get commissions from my Swiss customer, NNC Systems?

Tamara Elkind / 3:39 P.M.
Right. All existing clients in southern Switzerland go to Georg.

Georg Hertz / 3:41 P.M.
But what if I agree to let Judith keep NNC Systems?

Tamara Elkind / 3:42 P.M.
NNC Systems is a big client.

Georg Hertz / 3:44 P.M.
Yes, but I’d rather not interrupt a productive relationship. This one client is not that important to me.

Tamara Elkind / 3:45 P.M.
I don’t see it as interrupting, necessarily. However, if you are willing, Georg, I might be able to make an exception if our president approves it.

Judith Messer / 3:47 P.M.
What if I talk to the client?

Tamara Elkind / 3:48 P.M.
I don’t think that’s appropriate.

Judith Messer / 3:49 P.M.
Understood.

Georg Hertz / 3:49 P.M.
OK. We’ll wait to hear back from you.
Who most likely is Ms. Elkind?

answer.explanation:
Tamara Ekind/3:32 P.M
“Thanks for attending the virtual meeting earlier this afternoon. Are there any further questions?”
Tamara Ekind/3:45 P.M
“I might be able to make an exception if our president approves it.”

question.text: What is suggested about Ms. Messer?
choices: (A) She has a good relationship with  NNC Systems.
(B) She is being transferred to an office in Switzerland.
(C) She is happy with the new territory assigned to her.
(D) She did not attend the sales meeting.

answer.text: (A) She has a good relationship with  NNC Systems.
answer.explanation:
George Hertz / 3:41 P.M “ But what if I agree to let Judith keep NNC Systems?”
George Hertz / 3:44 P.M “Yes, but I’d rather not interrupt a productive relationship.”

question.text: At 3:42 P.M., what does Ms. Elkind most likely mean when she writes, "NNC Systems is a big client”?
choices: (A) She doubts Mr. Hertz can meet NNC Systems’ needs,
(B) She believes Mr. Hertz is misinformed.
(C) She wants Mr. Hertz to visit Switzerland.
(D) She thinks Mr. Hertz’s offer is surprising

answer.text: (D) She thinks Mr. Hertz’s offer is surprising
answer.explanation: George Hertz / 3:41 P.M “But what if I agree to let Judith keep NNC Systems?” Tamara Elkind / 3:42 P.M “NNC Systems is a big client”

question.text: What will most likely happen next?
choices: (A) Ms. Messer will review the new maps of sales territory.
(B) Ms. Messer will talk with her client.
(C) Ms. Elkind will contact the company’s president.
(D) Mr. Hertz will accept a job offer from NNC Systems.

answer.text: (C) Ms. Elkind will contact the company’s president.
answer.explanation:
Tamara Ekind/3:45 P.M
“I might be able to make an exception if our president approves it.”
Judith Messer / 3:47 P.M
“What if I talk to the client?”
Tamara Elkind / 3:48 P.M
“I don’t think that’s appropriate.”
Georg Hertz / 3:49 P.M
“Ok. We’ll wait to hear back from you.”

question.text:
Auburn City Restaurant Inspection


Restaurant Name: Polito’s Pizza Location: 43 Clark street Inspection Date: January 22
A: Comply completely with safety and health requirements with no violations
B: Conform to most safety and health requirements with a few minor violations
C: Not meet some safety and health requirements with some violations
D: Not satisfy many safety and health requirements with serious violations that could result in harm or illness for a customer
(Fines will be imposed for any c or D level violations related to food preparation and storage.)

Item Score
1. Personnel regularly wash hands and follow hygienic practices. B
2. Raw meats and vegetables are refrigerated at proper temperatures. A
3. All ingredients are properly stored and labeled. C
4. Dishes and utensils are cleaned and sterilized. A
5. Fire extinguishers are easily accessible. B
6. Fire exits are clearly marked C
7. Floors are clean and dry. B


To avoid additional penalties, restaurants are warned to correct violations before their next inspection.

Restaurant Owner: Greg Kluck
Inspector: Melissa Tenner

===========================

MEMO


To:All Employees employees@politospizza.com
From:Greg Kluck gregkluck@politospizza.com
Subject:Inspection Results
Date: January 25

Dear employees,

The results from our recent inspection on January 22 indicate that there are a few problems that we need to address.
First, it was brought to my attention that fire exit signs need to be installed again. The most serious violation concerned the improper storage and labeling of food. All ingredients stored for later use must be labeled with an exact date and detailed contents. If we do not label containers properly, spoiled food could accidently be served to customers. We received relatively low grades for employee hygiene and the cleanliness of our facilities. All employees are required to wear their uniform and hairnet at all times and wash their hands after every bathroom visit. We also need to mop floors more often and keep them dry.
In order to correct these poor situations, I will be posting a checklist that all employees will be required to complete every morning. It will include necessary preparations to ensure that we are not breaking any regulations. This measure will go into effect on January 29.
If you have any questions about these changes, please bring them up at the staff meeting tomorrow.

===========================

NOTICE TO ALL EMPLOYEES


The checklist below must be signed by every employee on every day that they have a shift at Polito’s Pizza. Only sign the task once it has been completed or checked. Failure to fill out the checklist with the date, time, and signature will be treated as a violation of Polito’s new health standards.

POLITO’S CHECKLIST

Polito’s Sun Mon Tue Wen Thu Fri Sat
Rotate Food K.P. K.P. K.P. K.P. K.P.
Mop Floors K.P. K.P. K.P. K.P. K.P.
Uniforms K.P. K.P. K.P. K.P. K.P.
Wash hands K.P. K.P. K.P. K.P. K.P.
Why has Polito’s Pizza been charged a fine?
choices: (A) Because fire extinguishers were not in place.
(B) Because containers of food were not marked appropriately.
(C) Because raw meats and vegetables were handled incorrectly.
(D) Because the facilities were not cleaned according to standards.

answer.text: (B) Because containers of food were not marked appropriately.
answer.explanation: According to the inspection report, "Fines will be valid for any C or D level violations related to food preparation and storage" But Polito restaurant got a score of C in the section "All ingredients are properly stored and labeled."

question.text: What will happen if an employee fails to sign the work checklist?
choices: (A) They will have a violation on their record.
(B) They will have to pay a fine.
(C) They will have to come in on the weekends.

answer.text: (A) They will have a violation on their record.
answer.explanation: “Failure to fill out the checklist with the date, time, and signature will be treated as a violation of Polito's new health standards.” (Việc khôn

question.text: What does Mr. Kluck ask his employees to do?
choices: (B) Wear a name tag at all times
(C) File a complaint with Ms. Tenner

answer.explanation: “I will be posting a checklist that all employees will be required to complete every morning.”

question.text: Based on Polito’s Checklist, what can we infer about K.P.?
choices: (B) He did not work on Thursday and Friday.
(C) He will be fired for violations.

answer.text: (B) He did not work on Thursday and Friday.
answer.explanation: As a rule, every day to work at the restaurant, the employee will have to sign the checklist, but K.P never signed on Thursday and Friday, so it can be inferred that he has no shift on these two days.

question.text: Why was the inspection conducted?
choices: (A) To monitor compliance with food industry regulations
(B) To rate the taste and quality of the cuisine
(C) To inspect the structural safety of the building
(D) To evaluate the effectiveness of new policies

answer.text: (A) To monitor compliance with food industry regulations
answer.explanation: It can be seen that the control points are all about a restaurant's compliance with the health and safety requirements. So answer A is the most accurate.

question.text:
September 21—What is the secret to delicious home-cooked meals? Kimberly Lee, host of the My Home Cooking television show and owner of her own restaurant chain, seems to know all the secrets. Her show has been on the air for over two years, and now she has a devoted group of followers around the country. When she sat down for an interview with US, she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food.
Ms. Lee is scheduled to publish her very first cookbook near the end of the month. The book is entitled Kimberly Lee’s My Home Cooking, and it provides easy-to- follow recipes that can be made in less than 30 minutes. Over 40,000 copies have already been pre-ordered so far.
Ms. Lee says that the final page of the book will include a detachable fan club membership form. Those who fill the form out and send it in to the provided address will receive a monthly newsletter and exclusive recipes available only to those in the fan club. Fan club members will also receive a password that allows access to a fan club website.

===========================

To: Kimberly Lee-kimberlylee@kimberlylee.com
From: Suzie Sanders - suziesanders@kimberlylee.com
Date: October 12
Subject: Update

Dear Ms. Lee,
Great news! I’m happy to report that not only has your book been selling well, but the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I’m certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book.
Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month’s newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time.
Sincerely,

Suzie Sanders Publicity
Coordinator
What is the first thing to do in order to become a fan club member?

answer.explanation: At the end of the article she Lee says the last page of the book has a membership registration form. So to be able to get the registration form, the first thing to do is to buy that book.

question.text: What is the main purpose of the article?
choices: (B) To provide advice for professional chefs

answer.explanation: It is easy to see that the main content of the article is about Ms. Lee and her upcoming book. So the correct answer is A.

question.text: What is suggested about next month’s newsletter?
choices: (A) It will be mailed behind schedule.
(B) It will feature a column about healthy eating habits.
(C) It will contain an article on desserts.
(D) It will include a copy of Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It will contain an article on desserts.
answer.explanation:
Derived from the last two sentences of the letter: “Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month's newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time. ”
So if they meet the members' request, next month's letter will have recipes for desserts like cakes and candies.

question.text: In the e-mail, what does Suzie Sanders say about the article?
choices: (A) It was written by a famous journalist.
(B) It was featured on a popular cooking website.
(C) It helped increase fan club membership.
(D) It contained excerpts from Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It helped increase fan club membership.
answer.explanation: The information at the beginning of the email: “the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I'm certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book. ”

question.text: Accordingto Ms. Lee, what is the secret to successful cooking?

answer.explanation: Information in the following sentence in the article “she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food”

To All Team Leads:
Please be informed that both Building 3 conference rooms will be unavailable throughout the day on Monday, March 12, as our division of Brenton Solutions will be hosting the Corporate Management team. These meetings are expected to begin promptly at 9:30 A.M. and to extend one full hour past the time that afternoon meetings usually end. Any team leads in need of conference space on this date should send me their request no later than Friday by replying directly to this e-mail. Space will be reserved on a first-come, first-served basis. Thanks!
Janet Marten, Corporate Secretary

Keep in mind that these rooms are both meeting spaces that have limited capacity, so please plan accordingly. Meetings not addressed above are canceled. Any questions regarding meetings or cancellations should be directed to team leads. Meeting notes will be posted electronically in the usual location for those who are unable

question.text:
**E-mail**
To: Kate Millerson
From: Daniel Friedman
Date: January 25
Subject: Upcoming focus group
 
Hi, Kate,
 
The next focus group to test the new fruit-flavored beverage ideas will be held on February 1 in the Greenville office. Mari Kobayashi will be leading it.
 
Please design a questionnaire to collect the group’s feedback using the one you created last month as a template and send it over to Mari. After the focus group takes place, please tally the results in the form of a chart. I need to incorporate this information into my monthly report to the chief marketing officer.
 
Thanks,
 
Daniel
 
 

=========================
***E-mail***
To:     Daniel Friedman
From: Kate Millerson 
Date: February 3
Subject: Results of Greenville focus group
Attachment: Greenville Results

Hi, Daniel,

According to Mari Kobayashi, 25 of the 30 registered participants for Greenville took the taste test and completed the questionnaire. The results are mostly in line with the results from last month’s focus group. However, Mari did note that the Greenville group’s most popular flavor was unexpected.

Per your request, the tabulated results are attached. Please let me know if you will need additional information for your report to Ms. Acosta or if  she wants  to see the comments on the questionnaires.

Kate

=========================

@PS@/kstoeic/images/8880552_1584927675688.png@PE@

Email 2:

question.text:
New Start Home stores accept donations of new or used furniture, appliances, housewares, and building materials. Items should be in good condition. Items that require repair or are stained or ripped cannot be accepted. Proceeds from the sale of our goods are used to fund community projects, such as educational programs, housing renovations, and neighborhood park beautification.
How to donate:
1. Using our home screen, find the New Start Home nearest you by entering your address into the search box.
2. Drop off your unneeded goods yourself or contact your nearest location to schedule pickup of large items or bulk donations from your home or business.
3. Please check our Web site for the hours of each store location.
============================
From: bmoris@morriscountryinn.com
To: aperez@newstarthome.org
Date: March 27
Re: Donation
Dear Mr. Perez,
I am the owner of the Morris Country Inn in Canton. It will be closing permanently when I retire next month. I have many pieces of furniture in excellent condition—beds, desks, easy chairs, and more. A friend suggested that this inventory could be donated to your organization. The New Start Home branch in Hartford seems to be the closest to my inn, and I see that you are the store manager there. We are located almost 35 miles away. Can I arrange a pickup of these goods at my establishment?
Regards,
Brenda Morris
Morris Country Inn
============================
Morris Country Inn Shutting Its Doors
CANTON (April 27)—Brenda Morris watched the New Start Home truck drive away, full of furnishings from the Morris Country Inn. She has been the owner-operator of the inn, a local landmark, for 40 years. “I am happy to be heading to Seaview Point, with its beaches and warm weather,” remarked Ms. Morris. “And I now plan to spend time volunteering and just relaxing. But the inn has been a big part of my life, and it will be hard leaving this community.”
The property that the Morris Country Inn currently stands on has been sold to the Brent Valley Development Group, which plans to convert the building into apartment units over the coming year.
According to the Web page, what does New Start Home do with items it receives?

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of the first paragraph, the store accepts to donate, then sells them to use the money for community projects ...

question.text: How did Ms. Morris most likely learn the name of a manager at New Start Home?
choices: (C)By reading an article in the local newspaper

answer.explanation: Based on the above paragraph which is information from a web page, we can choose A. The remaining answers are not relevant or mentioned.

question.text: What is indicated about Ms. Morris in the e-mail?
choices: (A) She visited New Start Home with a friend.
(C)She has decided to close a business.

answer.text: (C)She has decided to close a business.
answer.explanation: The sentence "It will be closing when I retire next month" for right answer C

question.text: What is suggested about the New Start Home branch in Hartford?
choices: (C)It has sold out of its current inventory.
(D)It picks up donations in nearby towns.

answer.text: (D)It picks up donations in nearby towns.
answer.explanation: Based on the website content above and the email content saying "35 miles away" we can deduce that the store can accept donations from other places.

question.text: According to the article, where is Ms. Morris planning to live next?

answer.explanation: "Heading to Seaview Point" => choose answer B immediately
